QuICT.core.gate package¶

Submodules¶

QuICT.core.gate.exec_operator module¶

This file is to define the execute operator to be inherited by more than one gate.

QuICT.core.gate.exec_operator.QState_deal_ccx_gate(qState, gate)¶

apply a toffoli gate on this qState

Parameters

  • qState (QState) – the QState to be dealt

  • gate (BasicGate) – the gate to be applied.

Exceptions:

FrameworkException: the index is out of range

QuICT.core.gate.extension_gate module¶

class QuICT.core.gate.extension_gate.CCRzModel(alias=None)¶

Bases: QuICT.core.gate.extension_gate.gateModel

controlled-Rz gate with two control bits

build_gate(other=None)¶
the overloaded the build_gate can return two kind of values:

1)list<BasicGate>: in this way, developer use gateBuilder to generator a series of gates 2)Circuit: in this way, developer can generator a circuit whose bits number is same as the

qureg the gate, and apply gates on in. for Example:

qureg = self.qureg_trans(qureg) circuit = len(qureg) X | circuit return X

Parameters

qureg – the gate

Returns

synthetize result

Return type

Circuit/list<BasicGate>

QuICT.core.gate.extension_gate.extension_gate_implementation(cls)¶
class QuICT.core.gate.extension_gate.gateModel(alias=None)¶

Bases: object

the abstract SuperClass of all complex quantum gates

These quantum gates are generally too complex to act on reality quantum hardware directly. The class is devoted to give some reasonable synthetize of the gates so that user can use these gates as basic gates but get a series one-qubit and two-qubit gates in final.

All complex quantum gates described in the framework have some common attributes and some common functions which defined in this class.

Note that all subClass must overloaded the function “build_gate”, the overloaded of the function “__or__” and “__call__” is optional.

controls¶

the number of the control bits of the gate

Type

int

cargs¶

the list of the index of control bits in the circuit

Type

list<int>

carg¶

the first object of cargs

Type

int, read only

targets¶

the number of the target bits of the gate

Type

int

targs¶

the list of the index of target bits in the circuit

Type

list<int>

targ¶

the first object of targs

Type

int, read only

params¶

the number of the parameter of the gate

Type

list

pargs¶

the list of the parameter

Type

list

prag¶

the first object of pargs

Type

read only

type¶

gate’s type described by ExtensionGateType

Type

GateType, read only

build_gate(qureg=None)¶
the overloaded the build_gate can return two kind of values:

1)list<BasicGate>: in this way, developer use gateBuilder to generator a series of gates 2)Circuit: in this way, developer can generator a circuit whose bits number is same as the

qureg the gate, and apply gates on in. for Example:

qureg = self.qureg_trans(qureg) circuit = len(qureg) X | circuit return X

Parameters

qureg – the gate

Returns

synthetize result

Return type

Circuit/list<BasicGate>

property cargs¶
property controls¶
copy()¶

copy the gate

property params¶
property parg¶
property pargs¶
static permit_element(element)¶

judge whether the type of a parameter is int/float/complex

for a quantum gate, the parameter should be int/float/complex

Parameters

element – the element to be judged

Returns

True if the type of element is int/float/complex

Return type

bool

static qureg_trans(other)¶

tool function that change tuple/list/Circuit to a Qureg

For convince, the user can input tuple/list/Circuit/Qureg, but developer need only deal with Qureg

Parameters

other – the item is to be transformed, it can have followed form: 1) Circuit 2) Qureg 3) tuple<qubit, qureg> 4) list<qubit, qureg>

Returns

the qureg transformed into.

Return type

Qureg

Raises

TypeException – the input form is wrong.

property targ¶
property targets¶
property targs¶

class QuICT.core.gate.gate.BarrierGate(alias=None)¶

Bases: QuICT.core.gate.gate.BasicGate

Barrier gate

In IBMQ, barrier gate forbid the optimization cross the gate, It is invalid in out circuit now.

execute on the circuit

should be overloaded by subClass

class QuICT.core.gate.gate.BasicGate(alias=None)¶

Bases: object

the abstract SuperClass of all basic quantum gates

All basic quantum gates described in the framework have some common attributes and some common functions which defined in this class

the number of the control bits of the gate

Type

int

cargs¶

the list of the index of control bits in the circuit

Type

list<int>

the first object of cargs

Type

int, read only

the number of the target bits of the gate

Type

int

targs¶

Type

list<int>

Type

the number of the parameter of the gate

list

the first object of pargs

read only

Type

str, read only

gate’s type described by GateType

Type

GateType, read only

matrix¶

the unitary matrix of the quantum gates act on targets

Type

np.array

computer_matrix¶

the unitary matrix of the quantum gates act on controls and targets

Type

np.array

is_control_single() → bool¶

judge whether gate has one control bit and one target bit

Returns

True if it is has one control bit and one target bit

Return type

bool

is_diagonal() → bool¶

judge whether gate’s matrix is diagonal

Raises

gate must be basic one qubit gate or two qubit gate –

Returns

True if gate’s matrix is diagonal

Return type

bool

is_single() → bool¶

judge whether gate is a one qubit gate(excluding special gate like measure, reset, custom and so on)

Returns

True if it is a one qubit gate

Return type

bool

QuICT.core.gate.gate.GATE_ID_CNT = 34¶

Gate number counter.

QuICT.core.gate.gate.GATE_REGISTER = {-1: 'Error', 0: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.HGate'>, 1: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.SGate'>, 2: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.SDaggerGate'>, 3: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.XGate'>, 4: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.YGate'>, 5: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.ZGate'>, 6: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.IDGate'>, 7: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.U1Gate'>, 8: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.U2Gate'>, 9: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.U3Gate'>, 10: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.RxGate'>, 11: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.RyGate'>, 12: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.RzGate'>, 13: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.TGate'>, 14: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.TDaggerGate'>, 15: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.CZGate'>, 16: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.CXGate'>, 17: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.CYGate'>, 18: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.CHGate'>, 19: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.CRzGate'>, 20: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.CCXGate'>, 21: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.MeasureGate'>, 22: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.ResetGate'>, 23: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.BarrierGate'>, 24: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.SwapGate'>, 25: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.PermGate'>, 26: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.ControlPermMulDetailGate'>, 27: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.PermShiftGate'>, 28: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.ControlPermShiftGate'>, 29: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.PermMulGate'>, 30: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.ControlPermMulGate'>, 31: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.PermFxGate'>, 32: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.UnitaryGate'>, 33: <class 'QuICT.core.gate.gate.ShorInitialGate'>}¶

class QuICT.core.gate.gate.MeasureGate(alias=None)¶

Bases: QuICT.core.gate.gate.BasicGate

z-axis Measure gate

Measure one qubit along z-axis. After acting on the qubit(circuit flush), the qubit get the value 0 or 1 and the amplitude changed by the result.

class QuICT.core.gate.gate.PermGate(alias=None)¶

Bases: QuICT.core.gate.gate.BasicGate

Permutation gate

A special gate defined in our circuit, It can change an n-qubit qureg’s amplitude by permutaion, the parameter is a 2^n list describes the permutation.

class QuICT.core.gate.gate.ShorInitialGate(alias=None)¶

Bases: QuICT.core.gate.gate.BasicGate

a oracle gate to preparation the initial state before IQFT in Shor algorithm

backends will preparation the initial state by classical operator with a fixed measure result of second register.

QuICT.core.gate.gate.gate_implementation(cls)¶

QuICT.core.gate.gate_builder module¶

class QuICT.core.gate.gate_builder.GateBuilderModel¶

Bases: object

A model that help users get gate without circuit

The model is designed to help users get some gates independent of the circuit Because there is no clear API to setting a gate’s control bit indexes and target bit indexes without circuit or qureg.

Users should set the gateType of the GateBuilder, than set necessary parameters (Targs, Cargs, Pargs). After that, user can get a gate from GateBuilder.

static apply_gates(gate: QuICT.core.gate.gate.BasicGate, circuit: QuICT.core.circuit.circuit.Circuit)¶

act a gate on some circuit.

Parameters

  • gate (BasicGate) – the gate which is to be act on the circuit.

  • circuit (Circuit) – the circuit which the gate acted on.

once the parameters are set, the function is valid.

the gate with parameters set in the builder

act the inverse of a series of gates on some circuit.

Parameters

  • gates (list<BasicGate>) – the gate list whose inverse is need to be gotten.

  • circuit (Circuit) – the circuit which the inverse acted on.

static reflect_gates(gates: list)¶

build the inverse of a series of gates.

Parameters

gates (list<BasicGate>) – the gate list whose inverse is need to be gotten.

Returns

the inverse of the gate list.

Return type

list<BasicGate>

setArgs(args)¶

pass the bits’ indexed of the gate by one time

The control bits’ indexed first, and followed the targets bits’ indexed.

Parameters

args (list/int/float/complex) – the act bits’ indexes of the gate

setCargs(cargs)¶

pass the control bits’ indexes of the gate

if the gate don’t need the control bits, needn’t to call this function.

Parameters

cargs (list/int/float/complex) – the control bits’ indexes the gate act on.

setGateType(type)¶

pass the gateType for the builder

Parameters

type (int) – the type passed in

setPargs(pargs)¶

pass the parameters of the gate

if the gate don’t need the parameters, needn’t to call this function.

Parameters

pargs (list/int/float/complex) – the parameters filled in the gate

setTargs(targs)¶

pass the target bits’ indexes of the gate

The targets should be passed.

Parameters

targs (list/int/float/complex) – the target bits’ indexes the gate act on.
